frameDefinitions: A Speaker communicates a message stating an Item's membership in a Category, i.e., asserts that the Item has the defining characteristics of the Category.
This frame contains verbs and nouns that communicate the act of a Speaker to address a Message to some Addressee using language.
An Agent performs some Action which is considered imprudent.
A Question about the reason or cause of a known State_of_affairs is presented as being answered by the existence of a particular Fact.
An Arguer presents a Content, along with Support, to an Addressee.
An Agent has done or omitted to do an Act or is responsible for the obtaining of a State_of_affairs, which a Judge deems to constitute a violation of an obligation or a moral guideline.
frameExamples: He <t>depicted</t> his involvement as merely peripheral.
I now <t>declare</t> you members of this Society.
Ruby's orange vest marked with the words 'service dog' <t>accounts</t> for why the 3-year-old goes along.
Jan <t>argued</t> that the evidence was inadmissable.
Kim failed to fully <t>justify</t> his decision.
listRoleDefinitions: The individual that communicates the message concerning the <fen>Category</fen> of an <fen>Item</fen>.
The class of entities with characteristics that match those of the <fen>Item</fen> according to the portrayal of the <fen>Speaker</fen>.
The entity that the <fen>Speaker</fen> portrays as belonging to a <fen>Category</fen>.
The piece of text in which a <fen>Speaker</fen> communicates their categorization of the <fen>Item</fen>.
The point in time at which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes a characterization of the <fen>Item</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Speaker</fen> characterizes the <fen>Item</fen>

The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that produces the <fen>Message</fen> (whether spoken or written).  It is normally expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of the <t>target	</t> word, or as the Genitive modifier of the noun.
The <fen>Message</fen> is the role that identifies the content of what the <fen>Speaker</fen> is communicating to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.  It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about', but in some cases it can appear as a direct object.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the statement.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Message</fen> is made.
The role specifies the location where the <fen>Message</fen> takes place.
The individual that performs the <fen>Action</fen>, resulting in danger to themself.
This role denotes the <fen>Action</fen> taken by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Agent</fen> dares to perform the <fen>Action</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> risks doing the <fen>Action</fen>.
A <fen>Fact</fen> which can be connected by a chain of reasoning to the <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>.
A <fen>Fact</fen> whose cause is under consideration.
An open proposition concerning the cause of the <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>.

The <fen>Arguer</fen> wants the <fen>Addressee</fen> to entertain the <fen>Content</fen>, which can be a proposition to be believed or a course of action to be taken, based on the <fen>Support</fen> presented.
The <fen>Arguer</fen> presents the <fen>Content</fen> before the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The Time at which an <fen>Arguer</fen> makes an argument for the <fen>Content</fen>.
This role identifies the location where an argument is made by an <fen>Arguer</fen>.
The person or organization that  is held responsible for a prior <fen>Act</fen> or for a <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>.
An action  for which the <fen>Agent</fen> is held responsible, frequently one that the <fen>Agent</fen> has taken themself.
A <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> that the Agent is held responsible for.
The <fen>Time</fen> of the justifying event.
listRoleExamples: However, <fex>'A Brief History of Medicine'</fex> characterizes influenza as the most deadly plague, overall.
<fex>Evelyn</fex> spoke feelingly about what happened.
Evelyn said <fex>that she was not ready to leave</fex>.
Evelyn spoke candidly <fex>about her past</fex>.
Kim preached to me <fex>over the phone</fex>.
In some remarks <fex>at the National Press Club</fex>, Mr. Keating said he would make a better prime minister tha nMr. Hawke.
I do n't think <fex>you</fex> should hazard the ascent in the dark , that 's all .
I chanced <fex>a peek at myself</fex>.
<fex>At dawn</fex>, the Captain chanced opening the hatch.
<fex>Back in his room</fex>, he risked peeking inside.
<fex>This fact</fex> alone explains the Sun/climate anomaly.
Do increased proinsulin concentrations explain <fex>the excess risk of coronary heart disease in diabetic and prediabetic subjects</fex>?
The fact that this remained in Pandora's box explains <fex>why men have hope</fex>.
Jan argued <fex>that the evidence was inadmissable</fex>.
<fex>Jan</fex> argued that the evidence was inadmissable.
The government argued <fex>in August</fex> that the prisoners should not be released
The young men will be arguing their policies <fex>in the school auditorium</fex>.
<fex>Smithers</fex> defended his decision by insisting that he had used his best judgment
Kim failed  to fully justify <fex>his decision</fex>.
The lawyers tried  to justify <fex>enormous punitive damages being paid to victims on a first-past-the-post system</fex> .

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the International Association for the Study of Pain (IASP
